title: Unit 4 Checkpoint: Contextual Applications of Differentiation
description: Summative checkpoint assessing related rates, straight-line motion, linearization/differentials, and L'Hôpital's Rule. Emphasis on setup, diagram, units, and justification.

remediationResources.reteachFocus: Draw diagram, label variables, write equation relating variables, differentiate implicitly w.r.t. time, substitute known values AFTER differentiating
v=s', a=v'=s''; speed=|v|; speeding up when v and a same sign; displacement=∫v dt, distance=∫|v| dt
L(x)=f(a)+f'(a)(x−a); tangent line approximation; concave up→underestimate, concave down→overestimate
ONLY for 0/0 or ∞/∞ forms; verify indeterminate FIRST; differentiate top and bottom separately (not quotient rule)

assessmentProblems.question: A 10-ft ladder leans against a wall. The bottom slides away at 2 ft/s. How fast is the top sliding down when the bottom is 6 ft from the wall?
assessmentProblems.answer: Let x = dist from wall, y = height. x²+y²=100. When x=6: y=√(100-36)=8. Differentiate: 2x(dx/dt)+2y(dy/dt)=0. Substitute: 2(6)(2)+2(8)(dy/dt)=0 → 24+16(dy/dt)=0 → dy/dt = −3/2 ft/s. The top slides down at 3/2 ft/s.

assessmentProblems.question: A spherical balloon is inflated at a rate of 100π cm³/s. How fast is the radius increasing when r = 5 cm?
A particle moves along a line with velocity v(t) = t² − 5t + 4 (m/s). (a) When is the particle at rest? (b) When is it moving left? (c) Find the total distance traveled on [0, 5].
Use linearization of f(x) = √x at a = 25 to approximate √26.
Evaluate using L'Hôpital's Rule: lim_{x→0} (eˣ − 1)/sin(x)
assessmentProblems.answer: Check: at x=0, e⁰−1=0 and sin(0)=0 → 0/0 form ✓. Apply L'Hôpital: lim_{x→0} eˣ/cos(x) = e⁰/cos(0) = 1/1 = 1.

assessmentProblems.question: Evaluate using L'Hôpital's Rule: lim_{x→∞} x²/eˣ
assessmentProblems.answer: At x→∞: x²→∞ and eˣ→∞ → ∞/∞ form ✓. Apply L'Hôpital: lim 2x/eˣ. Still ∞/∞. Apply again: lim 2/eˣ = 0. (eˣ dominates any polynomial.)

assessmentProblems.question: A particle has position s(t) = sin(t) + cos(t) for t ≥ 0. Find all times in [0, 2π] when the particle is at rest and determine whether it's speeding up at t = π.
assessmentProblems.answer: v(t) = cos(t) − sin(t). At rest: cos(t) = sin(t) → tan(t) = 1 → t = π/4, 5π/4. a(t) = −sin(t) − cos(t). At t=π: v(π) = −1−0 = −1, a(π) = 0−(−1) = 1. v<0 and a>0 → opposite signs → slowing down.

assessmentProblems.question: ANALYSIS: Two cars leave an intersection. Car A travels north at 40 mph. Car B travels east at 30 mph. How fast is the distance between them increasing after 2 hours?
assessmentProblems.answer: After 2 hrs: A is 80 mi north, B is 60 mi east. Distance d = √(x²+y²). At t=2: d = √(3600+6400) = √10000 = 100 mi. Differentiate: 2d(dd/dt) = 2x(dx/dt)+2y(dy/dt) → dd/dt = [x(dx/dt)+y(dy/dt)]/d = [60(30)+80(40)]/100 = [1800+3200]/100 = 5000/100 = 50 mph.

assessmentProblems.question: Evaluate: lim_{x→0} (1 − cos x)/x²
assessmentProblems.answer: 0/0 form. L'Hôpital: lim sin(x)/(2x). Still 0/0. L'Hôpital again: lim cos(x)/2 = 1/2.

answerKeys.cbu4-8: At rest: t=π/4, 5π/4. Slowing down at t=π.
